title: Come Esportare Mail e Cartelle da Thunderbird 68.10 ?
content:
Su di un pc ho installato Thunderbird 68.10, un solo profilo (hotmail), voglio trasferire su di un altro pc con installato Thunderbird 115 la rubrica e (in "posta in arrivo") le sottocartelle create e le email, non voglio trasferire il profilo o altro ma solo questi 3 elementi.

Ho provato con un paio di "export tools" ma non é possibile installarne nessuno perché non compatibili con Thunderbird 68.10.

Thunderbird 68.10 ha un tasto "importa" ma non un tasto "esporta"...

Suppongo che a questo punto si debba procedere manualmente a trasferire le cartelle necessarie...ma quali sono?
creator: aconita

title: "Not Junk" not working
content: This started when I received an email that spoofed my own email address and I marked it "Junk". The problem is that I send myself emails with reminders and other information that I want to access later. Now, whenever I send myself an email, it ends in Junk. I made sure my email address is in all of the address/contacts lists on Thunderbird. Every time emails from my own address end up in Junk, I use shift+J to mark them "not junk". I have done this at least a 100 times for numerous messages. I disabled junk processing, restarted, delete the junk folder, re-enable junk processing, start thunderbird again. How can I remove my own email address from the Junk filter?
creator: RML_Seattle

title: Attempting to revert from Tbunderbird 115.4.1 to 52.9.1
content:
I took a backup image of my C:\ Drive. My profile folder is on F:\users\tanya\profiles. My mail folder is on f:\users\tanya\mail I backed up both of these folders with Macrium.

I installed 78.14 and ran it then installed 115.4.1 and tried to configure it. Had some problems. Gave up. Decided to revert to 52.9.1 until I could resolve the issues.

Restore my C:\ drive from my image backed up the updated mail and profile folders on F:\drive. Delete the mail and profiles folders Restored the mail and profiles folders from my original backup.

Now, I can't add/remove themes. Searches fail with "not found" My addons were disabled and I can install them from an xpi file, but not from online. I can't even search and find them online Calendar and tasks have disappeared and I can't get them back.

What did I miss?

title: Latest upgrade
content:
I hope you didn't intend it, but what on earth have you done in the most recent Thunderbird "update"? Almost every day I delete an email from my inbox by right-clicking and selecting delete from the drop-down. Maybe the chain is complete, quite often it's something suspicious that has slipped by the spam filters and I simply do not want to open it, sometimes it's a delivery company telling me that my parcel has arrived, which I already know. It is always a simple operation and I carry on with my activities. Now however, when I do this, the inbox resets to the very beginning, to the first email that I did not delete, back in 2010 when I first became a user, and I have to scroll through 13 years to get back to today.

Please fix it, quickly. Derek Peters
creator: derek.peters

title: Thunderbird 115.4.1 failing to post to usenet then deleting the saved draft
content:
When using Thunderbird 115.4.1 to post a Followup on usenet, e.g. in comp.lang.awk, via my account at eternalseptember.org, roughly 9 times out of 10 after I click the "Send" button Thunderbird will pop up a message box saying "Assembling message" and then just get stuck there. When I eventually get tired of waiting and "x" out of that popup window and save my message in Drafts, I see my message in Drafts and I can click on it to edit it and retry posting it but it will not post. When I close Thunderbird and re-open it the message has, again 9 times out of 10, disappeared from my drafts folder and also still hasn't been posted. When I have this problem I have to manually copy my draft message into a file on my desktop, close Thunderbird, re-open it, then go back to the message I was trying to reply to, click Followup on it again, then paste my saved message into the mail editor window and then hit "Send" and this time it always works.

This is new behavior that I haven't see in previous Thunderbird versions.

Is a fix or better workaround available?
creator: mortonspam

title: Best practice for including images in an HTML email footer
content:
BACKGROUND"

Ive setup Thunderbird to use a locally hosted (via dropbbox) HTML file for footers.

This allows me to edit the HTML file once and it will update for any users who are using it. This works fine.

Inside of the footers i have some images (logos etc) these are inserted into the HTML footers using the html tag.

The images themselves eg. the .png files are hosted on a web server. Ive tried to use a relative reference to a local version of the .png file but although this works locally when drafting for some reason when i send the email the image dosnt get sent with.

QUESTIONS"

a) For some users the email footers, with remote images work fine when they are drafting email and when the email is received. For other users the email footer works and the remote image works fine when drafting but when the email is sent the remote image does not load. Any idea why this might be and how i can fix it ?

b) I feel remote hosting the images may be over complicaiting things, instead i would prefer to have a local hosted image sent along with the email, ive tried to do this by referenceing a relative link from the HTML file to the IMG file, this works correctly when drafting the email, but when i send it the image does not get sent along with the email. Any idea why this might be and how i can fix it ?
creator: levene.sam

title: Secure message storage on Mac M1
content: Is it possible to move the location my emails are stored to a encrypted disc image and have Thunderbird use that location? Just wanting to not have my emails stored in plain text on my laptop for additional security. I already have File Vault on but would like additional security for my emails. Open to suggestions of other ways to go about accomplishing the same goal. Looking for a free option if possible. Thank you.
creator: roy60

title: New version display issues
content:
Used Thunderbird for years. No issues. Following upgrade to current version:

1. Usually opens multiple email tabs 2. Most current email is not visible. Drops below bottom line. Must scroll to see it. 3. If you delete the highlighted email, the next email is highlighted so light you can barely see it. 4. Often jumps to othe emails.

Ver 115.4.1

Older version was rock solid. Not sure if these are "features" or problems.
